name: Little One
desc: A little Tepetlisaurus that received theBlessing. It accompanied the Traveler on a pilgrimage to the Great Volcano of Tollan to remove the mark.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: Tepetlisaur Whelp
customize.desc:
A young Tepetlisaurus with the ability to tunnel between rocks and solid phlogiston.
They have not yet formed the horns on their forehead, and their digging skills are still developing as well. It is even common to hear about young Tepetlisaurs getting trapped by rocks while practicing their digging. However, one day, they will grow into a form that may travel freely through even the toughest of soils.

customize.text: Little One is a special Tepetlisaur Whelp.

customize.name: Xiuhcoatl
customize.desc: The Pyro Sovereign, defeated by the first Pyro Archon, Xbalanque. He faked his own death, after which the descendants of the ancient dragons could only bow before the throne and watch as their civilization inevitably faded away with each passing day.

customize.text: Little One received the Flamelord's Blessing — a special mark on the horn, which grants a greater strength than an ordinary Saurian.

customize.name: Ancient Sacred Mountain
customize.desc: Before the descendants of the various tribes learned to record their history with woven scrolls, the ancient and proud nobility had already built a magnificent holy city here, scorning the land that those feeble slaves knew as "Natlantea." However, the vast empire that prided itself on its power has long since perished in battle. Only a lonely tomb remains of that mighty city.

customize.text: Little One was going on a pilgrimage to the volcano to remove the mark and regain the

customize.name: Night Kingdom
customize.desc: The Lord of the Night designed a realm of souls and memories to recreate the damaged Ley Lines in Natlan. The Night Kingdom is a mysterious, liminal space between the body and mind, life and death, where the souls of all the dead Natlanese go.

customize.text: acceptance.

customize.name: Waxaklahun Ubah Kan
customize.desc: The wisest among dragons, who stole the flame from his kind and taught people how to use it. He wanted to create a ruler of the dragon and human worlds. His true name is Kukulkan.

customize.text: Waxaklahun Ubah Kan needed the Chosen of the Dragon to remove the seal from the Sacred City of Tollan, so he created a legend that a pilgrimage to the volcano can remove the Flamelord's Blessing. He lured Little One into the Heart of the Sacred City to activate Huitzilopochtli.
Related Items

customize.name: Reaffirmed Accord of Appellation
customize.desc:
Just like when you first met and tied a scarf around his tail, now give him a new "name."
After giving him a new name, it cannot be changed again.

customize.name: Golden Entreaty
customize.desc: A white disc retrieved from the ruler of Cinder City's corroded ruins within Ochkanatlan. It is one of the essential tokens required to journey to the Great Volcano of Tollan and remove the "Flamelord's Blessing" from the little Tepetlisaur's body, and is said to have been one of the fragments left behind when the Flamelord's eye was split in two. According to legend, it is said that the ancient Dragonlord — who once held dominion over all light and wisdom — transformed one of his eyes into a conduit of supreme authority by which all flames might be governed, and that this became his only exploitable weakness...

customize.name: Golden Entreaty
customize.desc: A white disc retrieved from the ruins of the Sage of the Stolen Flame. It is one of the essential tokens required to journey to the Great Volcano of Tollan and remove the "Flamelord's Blessing" from the little Tepetlisaur's back. Golden inscriptions are etched into the surface of the white disc, and when touched, one can sense the intricate patterns pulsating as if imbued with life.

customize.name: Talisman of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan
customize.desc: The talisman of the Sage of the Stolen Flame. It is said that the sage who once stole phlogiston from a dragon's claws left this behind as proof of a pact made with the tribes.

customize.name: Photo With Travel Companions
customize.desc: A photo of you and your travel companions; a memento of a land where humans and saurians coexist. Though our paths may eventually diverge, the memories we create together shall never fade.

customize.text: Illustrations and Emojis
Paimon's Paintings Set 40

<color=#ffd780>April 1, 2025</color>
Greetings, Travelers! The latest emojis from Genshin Impact are now available on HoYoLAB~
Paimon's Paintings include a collection of chibi emojis of various Genshin Impact characters. We hope you like them! Paimon will continue to paint more cute emojis for everyone~
Flamelord's Blessing

Millennia ago, before the existence of humanity, Teyvat was ruled by dragons. When the First Descender appeared in the sky, the dragons were defeated, and the Pyro Dragon, Xiuhcoatl, was corrupted by the Abyss. To combat the reavers from beyond the skies and the enemies hidden in the shadows, the Flamelord created the
a weapon capable of transforming all of Natlan into a land made only of phlogiston matter. All life would be either destroyed or forced to abandon their physical bodies and become phlogiston-based life forms. Then the dragons, now phlogiston lifeforms, would rule this new world.

The ancient Dragonlord who once held dominion over all light and wisdom transformed one of his eyes into a control center for Huitzilopochtli, a conduit of supreme authority by which all flames might be governed. Since he needed to monitor and anchor himself in reality through the "eye," the "eye" became his only vulnerability, which is how he was killed. Xiuhcoatl's brother, Waxaklahun Ubah Kan, did not agree with the Pyro Dragon's plan, so he decided to find an answer among humans. When the first Pyro Archon Xbalanque defeated the Flamelord, he split his eye into two parts, the Golden Entreaties. The Golden Entreaties were a control center that could be used to reactivate the
For safekeeping, Xbalanque took one Golden Entreaty, and Waxaklahun Ubah Kan took the other. The Dragon Sage modified the Golden Entreaties so that both a human and a descendant of the dragons were required to return them to the Heart of the Sacred Mountain. The Sage of the Stolen Flame made a pact with the Pyro Archon that when the time came, they would unite their Golden Entreaties and activate Huitzilopochtli. He knew that the humans might not survive this disaster, but he hoped that a civilization would come later that would surpass both dragons and humans. Over time, Waxaklahun Ubah Kan grew disillusioned with humans and realized that the critical moment had arrived for the Abyss to spread across Natlan, so he decided to activate the Sweeping Skyfire.

When the reavers from beyond the skies took over Teyvat, they dropped the Divine Nail to destroy the phlogiston-rich land. With their incredible adaptability and ability to evolve, the dragons adapted to life on the new land, but this evolution changed the dragons to just survive. At first, the Pyro Dragon Sovereign channeled the light of
through his horn, but over time, the bodies of Xiuhcoatl's descendants became unable to withstand such power. They possessed incredible abilities, but as they grew older, this power either killed them or drove them mad.

In order to remove the seal from the Sacred City and unite the Golden Entreaties, Kukulkan needed a human and a saurian companion marked with the Flamelord's Blessing. He tried to control the Blessing's occurrence through experiments and created a legend that one must find a gift divided into two parts and make a pilgrimage to the Grand Volcano of Tollan. There, the tribal warriors could wash away the name of their companion, which the late Xiuhcoatl remembered, and remove the mark. A little Tepetlisaurus, which was found and saved from the Rifthounds by the Traveler and Paimon, was born with the Flamelord's Blessing. After tying a red scarf from Paimon's Emergency Backpack to his tail, they set off on adventures across Natlan. The space where they first met became a safe haven for the Tepetlisaurus, where he brought souvenirs from his travels.

customize.name: Tepetlisaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with a drill-like horn and strong claws that can tunnel through rocks and solid phlogiston.
According to legend, the ancestor of all Tepetlisaurs was a massive drake as large as a mountain, with an exceptionally long lifespan. When it slept, mountains would form along its back, and when it woke, it would shake off the dirt and rocks, leaving behind gems and jade shining amongst its scales. The huge, drill-shaped objects in the Children of Echoes are said to be the remains of that great drake's large drill-horn.

However, one day, they will grow into a form that may travel freely through even the toughest of soils.

customize.text: Golden Entreaty

To lure the Chosen of the Dragons to the Heart of the Sacred Mountain, Waxaklahun Ubah Kan took the form of the craftsman Manqu, who lived a thousand years ago, and posed as a member of the Saurian Relics Association. Manqu told the Traveler about the Flamelord's Blessing and a pilgrimage to a volcano. Although the volcano is a dangerous place and the Saurians cannot leave their tribes, the Traveler received permission from the chief of the Children of Echoes, whose companions are the Tepetlisaurus, by proving their strength and determination. To obtain the first Golden Entreaty, the Traveler and the Tepetlisaurus traveled to the ruins where the Sage of the Stolen Flame and Xbalanque once made an agreement to activate Huitzilopochtli.

Through a deep understanding, the Traveler and the Tepetlisaurus companion passed the special trials prepared by Waxaklahun Ubah Kan and met with the Abyssal monster to enter the final paradise. During the battle with the enemy hidden in the shadows, the Tepetlisaurus awakened his Flamelord's powers, easily crushing it. Upon entering the final paradise and touching the stone tablet with golden patterns, the Chosen of Dragons saw the eyes of the great dragon, split in two by the sword of the children of man, and a seal split asunder, engraved upon the white discs, mistaken for a hole. One part was given to the
white claws, the other to the
One was buried under the great monument, the other was swallowed into the belly of the
After that, a white disc with a golden pattern appeared under their feet; the first Golden Entreaty.

To get the second part of the token for the pilgrimage, the Traveler, Paimon, and the Tepetlisaurus companion went to the forbidden city of Ochkanatlan, where an evil dragon appeared 500 years ago, killing everyone who set foot on the city's soil. In Ochkanatlan, they met the Adventurer Bona and her companion, Cocouik, who saved them from the Abyssal monsters. Bona told the legend of the
— a treasure hidden on the flying ship "Tonatiuh" capable of suppressing the Abyss forever. Bona's father once went for the Jade of Return himself but never returned from the forbidden city, leaving his daughter with the Pyrophosphorite needed to obtain the artifact. Using the Pyrophosphorite, the Traveler, Bona, Paimon, and the Tepetlisaurus activated the Altar of Primal Fire and ascended to the Tonatiuh.

When they found the Jade of Return, it was seized by an evil dragon. The Traveler was able to catch up with and defeat the dragon deep underground in the Nursery of Nightmares. When the Traveler defeated the evil dragon, Cocouik was reunited with its body, revealing that the evil dragon that had been attacking the people was the ruler of Ochkanatlan, Och-Kan, who had died a thousand years ago and had been corrupted by the Abyss. Although he could not be cleansed of his corruption, he was able to share his memories with the Traveler and the Tepetlisaurus and slumbered in peace until the end of time. The
that the adventurers were after was only a legend created by Waxaklahun Ubah Kan. He knew that he could not obtain the Golden Entreaty hidden on the Tonatiuh himself, so he created a legend to lure the adventurers. When the Traveler and the Tepetlisaurus obtained the second Golden Entreaty, Waxaklahun Ubah Kan met with the Saurian in his memories and told him about the degradation of dragons, evolution, and his plan to save Natlan.

customize.name: Tequemecan Valley

customize.name: Ochkanatlan
customize.desc: In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment.

customize.name: Children of Echoes
customize.desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Nanatzcayan. The tribe's people are famous for mining and live alongside the Tepetlisaurs.

customize.name: Waxaklahun Ubah Kan
customize.desc: The wisest among dragons, who stole the flame from his kind and taught people how to use it. He wanted to create a ruler of the dragon and human worlds. His true name is Kukulkan.

The real Manqu was a craftsman who lived a thousand years ago and died during the overthrow of the tyrant Och-Kan. Now, Manqu is a phlogiston projection of Waxaklahun Ubah Kan.

customize.text: Final Entreaty

Once all the Golden Entreaties had been received, the Traveler, the Tepetlisaurus companion, and Paimon traveled to the Ancient Sacred Mountain, breaking the seal on the volcano and entering the ancient dragon city of Tollan. After clearing Tollan of the Abyss's corruption and gaining permission to enter the Heart of the Sacred Mountain, they reached the final test: a battle with a mechanical dragon. During the battle, Waxaklahun Ubah Kan trapped the Traveler and Paimon and showed the Tepetlisaurus the true Heart of the Sacred Mountain, where the remains of the slain Pyro Dragon remained. The Sage of the Stolen Flame gave the Saurian the guidance of the true Sacred Flame so that he could control the power of the Flamelord. From a small Saurian, the Tepetlisaurus grew into an adult who was able to speak and whose body was able to withstand all the power.

Waxaklahun Ubah Kan showed him the events of many millennia ago and hid his memories of his time with the Traveler and Paimon. The Sage of the Stolen Flame needed both Chosen of Dragons, the human and their Saurian companion, to enter the Sacred Mountain. But the human's mission was complete, and now the Tepetlisaurus had to activate Huitzilopochtli so that the great enemy hidden in the shadows could never invade again. He promised that when Natlan turned to phlogiston, the concept of life would be rewritten, and the power of the Primal Fire would return naturally. Only the dragons who had turned into phlogiston life forms would have all the power, and the Tepetlisaurus would become the new ruler, existing outside of normal boundaries and concepts. He would return all light, all warmth, all wisdom, bringing great order and glory to this world.
When Huitzilopochtli was activated, a world of pure white stretched before the Tepetlisaurus. Ten million years passed in what seemed but a moment, but time had no meaning. The only consciousness left in this world was "it," which had once been the Tepetlisaurus. Many great and mighty things happened in the world that once was. Countless wars of inconceivable scale, battles that tore dimensions asunder, uncounted lives swallowed and transformed until the blazing light devoured the most primordial rule. The shadow no longer threatened the world, but was it a world with any meaning? "It" knew that the primal flame was not inexhaustible, although it would burn for billions of years in this dark cosmic sea. Sometimes, "it" recalled, as if in a dream, how long ago it had traveled alongside two companions when the land was still tangible. Holding on to these memories, "it" thought it might yet endure the torment until death comes upon eternity's far shore. If "it" could return to the Heart of the Sacred City, would it make a different choice?
Seeing the fate that Huitzilopochtli had in store for the world and the Traveler and Paimon, the Tepetlisaurus refused to activate the Sweeping Skyfire and made the same choice as Waxaklahun Ubah Kan at the beginning of his journey. Knowing that he would lose his powers and the wisdom of the dragons, the Tepetlisaurus returned to the Traveler and Paimon and freed them from the trap. After defeating the mechanical dragon, the Tepetlisaurus became small again and lost consciousness.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Chosen of Dragons, I chose you... after much deliberation...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>And you have my thanks, for all you have done. I have always believed in you, I...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Ah... It is hard for me to say this, Traveler...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Never forget... that I love you."</color>

When Waxaklahun Ubah Kan's life was ended along with Huitzilopochtli's life cycle, the Tepetlisaurus companion mark lost its power and no longer threatened him. After countless adventures in which they cleansed the Shadow Pins and helped free the souls of fallen Khaenri'ahn warriors; traveled to the Upper Worlds to obtain an elixir that healed all wounds; found a Saurian egg that hatched into a Tepetlisaurus, Aguara; descended into the Night Kingdom to return a medium to the Wayob and helped many Saurians and humans, the Tepetlisaurus decided to go his own way. After bidding farewell to the Traveler and Paimon, he set out on a new adventure.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>
